de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter
Class PrettyAnnotation

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter.PrettyAnnotation

public final class PrettyAnnotation
extends Object

An annotation for the pretty printer. Annotations are used to mark regions within the text that are associated with a specific PrettyPrintable.

Version:
$Rev: 277 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
PrettyPrintable, PrettyString

Constructor Summary
PrettyAnnotation(int startOffset, int endOffset, int[] breakOffsets)
          Allocates a new annotation for the text within startIndex and endIndex.

          Returns the break offsets for this annotation.

          Returns the end offset of the annotation in the text.

Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

PrettyAnnotation

PrettyAnnotation(int startOffset,
                 int endOffset,
                 int[] breakOffsets)
Allocates a new annotation for the text within startIndex and endIndex. The breakOffsets specify the positions where breaks may be inserted for this annotation.

Parameters:
startOffset - the starting offset of the annotation in the text.
endOffset - the end offset of the annotation in the text (the last character of the annotation).
breakOffsets - the list of possible break offsets.
Method Detail

getBreakOffsets

public int[] getBreakOffsets()
Returns the break offsets for this annotation. The list of break offsets may be empty if no breaks are allowed within this annotation. Breaks should be applied all or nothing. That said, if you decide to break text for an annotation, you should break at all specified offsets.

Returns:
the break offsets for this annotation.

getStartOffset

public int getStartOffset()
Returns the start offset of the annotation in the text. The start offset points to the first character of the annotation in the text.

Returns:
the start offset of the annotation.

getEndOffset

public int getEndOffset()
Returns the end offset of the annotation in the text. The end offset points to the last character of the annotation in the text.

Returns:
the end offset of the annotation.
